1.text: My son! keep my sayings, And my commands lay up with thee.

2.text: Keep my commands, and live, And my law as the pupil of thine eye.

3.text: Bind them on thy fingers, Write them on the tablet of thy heart.

4.text: Say to wisdom, ‘My sister Thou art.’ And cry to understanding, ‘Kinswoman!’

5.text: To preserve thee from a strange woman, From a stranger who hath made smooth her sayings.

6.text: For, at a window of my house, Through my casement I have looked out,

7.text: And I do see among the simple ones, I discern among the sons, A young man lacking understanding,

8.text: Passing on in the street, near her corner, And the way to her house he doth step,

9.text: In the twilight—in the evening of day, In the darkness of night and blackness.

10.text: And, lo, a woman to meet him—(A harlot’s dress, and watchful of heart,

11.text: Noisy she is, and stubborn, In her house her feet rest not.

12.text: Now in an out-place, now in broad places, And near every corner she lieth in wait)—

13.text: And she laid hold on him, and kissed him, She hath hardened her face, and saith to him,

14.text: Sacrifices of peace-offerings are by me, To-day I have completed my vows.

15.text: Therefore I have come forth to meet thee, To seek earnestly thy face, and I find thee.

16.text: With ornamental coverings I decked my couch, Carved works—cotton of Egypt.

17.text: I sprinkled my bed—myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

18.text: Come, we are filled with loves till the morning, We delight ourselves in loves.

19.text: For the man is not in his house, He hath gone on a long journey.

20.text: A bag of money he hath taken in his hand, At the day of the new moon he cometh to his house.’

21.text: She turneth him aside with the abundance of her speech, With the flattery of her lips she forceth him.

22.text: He is going after her straightway, As an ox unto the slaughter he cometh, And as a fetter unto the chastisement of a fool,

23.text: Till an arrow doth split his liver, As a bird hath hastened unto a snare, And hath not known that it is for its life.

24.text: And now, ye sons, hearken to me, And give attention to sayings of my mouth.

25.text: Let not thy heart turn unto her ways, Do not wander in her paths,

26.text: For many are the wounded she caused to fall, And mighty are all her slain ones.

27.text: The ways of Sheol—her house, Going down unto inner chambers of death!
